explanation:

text: ''...O faithless and perverse generation, how long am I to be with you and bear with you..'' Jesus' statement above was addressed to

options.B: the Jews because of their unbelif

explanation:
This statement is recorded inLuke 9:41 (RSV)and other Synoptic Gospels (Matthew 17:17, Mark 9:19).
It was spoken byJesusafter His disciples failed to heal ademon-possessed boybrought by his father.The father complained to Jesus that the disciples could not cast out the demon.In response, Jesus expressed frustration at theirlack of faith and spiritual power, calling them a"faithless and perverse generation."He then proceeded to heal the boy Himself.

text: In the explanation of the parable of the weeds, Jesus said that the righteous will

options.A: enter into glory with the Son of man
options.B: live forever in the kingdom of God
options.C: shine like the sun in their Father's Kingdom
options.D: be set aside from all causes of sin

explanation: Matthew 13:24-13:30Jesus dismissed the crowds and went into the house. His disciples approached Him and said, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.” He said in reply, “He who sows good seed is the Son of Man, the field is the world, the good seed the children of the Kingdom. The weeds are the children of the evil one, and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the harvesters are angels. Just as weeds are collected and burned up with fire, so will it be at the end of the age. The Son of Man will send His angels, and they will collect out of His Kingdom all who cause others to sin and all evildoers. They will throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth. Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears ought to hear.”
